column2: In which course are you enrolled?
column3: Course design [The assigned readings have helped me meet the Learning Targets.]
column4: Course design [The RStudio primers have helped me meet the Learning Targets.]
column5: Course design [The Team Activities have helped me meet the Learning Targets.]
column6: Course design [The Learning Journals have helped me meet the Learning Targets.]
column7: Course design [The online class sessions have helped me meet the Learning Targets.]
column8: Course design [The Projects have helped me meet the Learning Targets.]
column9: Course design [The Applications have helped me meet the Learning Targets.]
column10: Course design [The Blackboard course site is organized in a way that helps me to effectively navigate the course materials.]
column11: Instructor [The instructor is genuinely interested in my understanding.]
column13: Instructor [The instructor is available for extra help when needed.]
column14: What as been the best aspect of *this course* so far, and why?
column15: If there was one thing about *this course* that you would change, what would it be, and why?
column16: What is one thing that *you* can do differently to improve your learning? Explain how you plan to do this.
column17: Optional: Provide any additional comments that you feel that were not addressed by the above items or that you wish to expand upon here.

column14: I really enjoyed the application activity and project. I think they have really measured my understanding of the material well and I like the way that they were set up.
column15: I don't really understand the "Team" aspect of this class. Every member of the team completes the activities individually, and then we just kind of pick one person's answers to submit. When I was placed into a team I really expected something more team-work like.
column16: I need to be better about tracking what is required/expected of me in this course. I just recently discovered that there are assignments that we are free to do at our leisure but I have been waiting for clear directions to do them and so haven't touched them. I need to put more work into understanding how this class is being run.

column14: There are two things that I think are the best aspects of this course. The first is my teammates. I think working with them increases my understanding and I feel like we are at similar skill levels, which is great! The other aspect is Professor Bradford. He is very helpful and easy to work with. He does a great job explaining things and guiding to a solution, rather than just giving the solution.
column15: Learning journals. I don't feel like I get much out of them. They kind of seem like busy work.
column16: I need to put a higher priority on the tasks in this course. I like programming, but it seems to be something that I tend to procrastinate with. I plan to be more proactive in starting the various tasks.
column17: Overall, I really like the format of this course. It actually feels like an in-person course and I am learning a lot because of that. I think it is great that we meet at a set time and get to work with other students.

column14: Covering  a wide variety of material, but with an emphasis on the tidyverse package, which is highly utilized in the professional workplace when dealing with data analysis in R.
column15: Kind of hard to say at this point in the course.  I have to see what all is covered in completing the course.  I am a bigger proponent of real-life examples, so maybe working through some complete analyses with datasets that aren't so simple in nature.  Perhaps retrieving data from an SQL database would be nice.
column16: I will probably purchase a book that covers ggplot and the tidyverse in order to read some supplemental information not covered in the R for Data Science book or in the primers and activities.

column14: I think learning how to work with groups remotely and how to code things together has been a cool learning experience
column15: I do not think that the learning journals have been personally helped me understand the material better. I know it is probably helpful for some people but for me, it is just another task that I keep forgetting about
column16: I think trying to memorize more thing. I am pretty good at knowing what to look up in the book and how to use the helper tool in R, but I think I need to know some more basic things by heart. I think the best way to go about learning this is just repetition.

column14: The class time together with groups has helped me understand the material best. Working with others and collaborating has helped tremendously.
column15: To do it in person. Obviously this is far out of anyone's control and is no fault of your own, so really not much can be done here.
column16: Practice more on the outside in dealing with R.

column14: The applications and the projects are the best aspect because it helps reinforce what I have learned in class
column15: The team work, because my team members mostly do not meet outside of class
column16: I would focus more on the readings outside of the classroom.

column14: The reading from the book has been pretty helpful
column15: If there was more going going over the material together. Such as going over the actives and the answers. There is not really a way to gage how well I really know the material and become better at it.
column16: perhaps reading more, or going over the primers again to better understand the coding

column14: Working in teams! I love my team and feel like I learn so much from them.
column15: For it to be in person
column16: Invest more time into assignments. I will no longer be working starting in November which will allow me to do so

column14: I like the group work, it allows us to collaborate on tasks and effectively finish them
column15: The workload amount is way too much for a 3-credit hour class. I feel overwhelmed with how much is needed to be completed each week in order to pass the class. I don't really gain anything from the learning journals.  I would rather just email the professor if I have questions. It would take a weight off of the coursework if I didn't have to worry about learning journals, preparations, follow-ups, applications, and projects all at the same time. I spend more time in this class doing coursework than I do in either of my other graduate classes, and because of this heavy amount of required assignments, its hard to manage other classes around this one.
column16: I should ask more questions when I am concerned on how to code properly. I'm new to R and sometimes I feel as I'm not grasping the concepts properly. Scheduling more office hour visits would definitely help with this.
column17: I wish there was more direct instruction from the teacher. As I stated earlier, I am new to R, and it feels like I am just "self-teaching", having lectures may help me better grasp the concepts and allow me to be more able to ask questions on these concepts while class is in session.

column14: The R Studio Primers, they are very interactive and stripped down to show you what your code is doing and why.
column15: I would really like some more time with the instructor during class time, going over examples of what we read about. We spend a lot of time reading about functions in the book and then are expected to know how to use them efficiently immediately the next class for the activity. I learn best by reading something first (like in the book), practicing them (R Primer) and then by seeing how other people (like the instructor) would use what we have learned for a few examples. It really feels like we are doing this alone.
column16: I need to read the book more often. Reading assigned sections just once before class has not been enough. It is hard to remember all of the details, especially when what we are learning is essentially another language.
column17:
I'm not very fond of the group work during class. Mainly because our group of 3 are all at different skill levels . We work at different speeds and it's definitely not a collaborative effort as intended. When I am stuck it seems its annoying to slow another groupmate down to help. I would prefer to do this group work outside of class and have more examples of how to use the code we've read about during class. More collaborative practice as a whole class would help towards the more individual components such as the apps and projects.

Another point I have is that it feels odd that we need to reach out for problems to complete in order to get a second checkmark for learning targets. It would be nice if these were assigned up front so we can work on them on our own time, instead of having another thing to schedule.

column14: Working on activities in class and in a group has been the best so far. This is the case, since it provides an opportunity to code together as a group and ask for help when problems arise.
column15: I would change the journal requirement since I have benefited to much from doing a few of them. Also, trying to come up with an idea for an entry can be difficult at times and sometimes results in a forced entry with little thought behind the writing.
column16: I need to make a habit of breaking code down and testing the result at each line, so that I know how it works and could potentially answer a problem in another assignment.
column17: Although, I mentioned that the activities in class are the best aspect in the course, the other assignments are also really nice and helpful. The projects and applications really allow me to test my skill and knowledge. Based on the first application I was able to learn a bit more from the learning target that I was not able to fulfill. Which means I might have a better chance on the next application to attempt that learning target.

column14: I really enjoy the activities and projects. They really help me understand my progress and also makes me more comfortable with R.
column15: Some questions asked in the activities are a little unclear. So maybe more specification or details with questions could help.
column16: I need to read the textbook more and go through examples. Create a habit of reading it for at least 30 minutes a day.

column14: I have enjoyed learning the base work for R coding.
column15: I would enjoy the class more if there were more lecture aspects and examples besides learning most of it on our own in Prep Primers.
column16: I need to be more diligent in note taking to accumulate all of the functions and purposes in one location.

column14: Learning how to use R effectively.
column15: Maybe more singular activities as compared to team activities, but I do like the set up as is.
column16: Find better sources for when I have questions about coding. I could do this by building a list of websites and/or forums that I ave found useful in the past.

column14: I really like the R Studio primers. They explain things really well, and I like the option to see a solution if what I have isn't quite working right.
column15: I am not a fan of the learning journals. I really just forget that I'm supposed to be doing them and other times I don't know what to say in them.
column16: I need to organize my notes. I like to take notes on each of the R studio primer activities and readings, but I need to do a better job of describing what each function does and how to use it. I know that you can type things like ?filter into the console to easily find the basics, but some of the language used in those descriptions does not help me, so I prefer to have it written out in my own words with examples.
column17: I'm just hoping that things start "clicking" for me soon because in all honesty, I was looking up the withdrawal deadline the other day. I plan on utilising office hours more to clarify any questions I have, which should help, but this class has been super difficult for me thus far.

column14: I really like that we are broken into smaller groups because that is what I am more comfortable with versus asking questions in front of the whole class.
column15: Although they are helpful, there are a lot of preparations, I feel like they should just all be due at the beginning of the week simply because it is a lot to keep track of and having it all on one day is more convenient.
column16: I can try to work ahead a little more so that I'm not doing things the night before.

column14: I think R is a great coding language and will be very helpful for me.
column15: I would change the team format for class. I have a hard time getting my teamates to cooperate.
column16: I could take more notes during the readings.
column17: I definitely feel like the team format is really hard to manage with the online format. I feel especially for the follow ups, I have a very hard time getting my teammates to follow through.

column14: working with groups is helpful
column15: Learning from the professor. Class has been read the book, do the primers, and group activity. We have not done anything as a class as a whole or anything really with our professor.
column16: Do more learning journals, I just am so overwhelmed still with class work from all my classes that they get pushed pretty low on the priority list. Breaks are necessary to prevent burnout and I rarely have time to take a break.

column14: How easy it is to ask Bradford questions during class
column15: Answer keys. I really like that the primers have solutions, so that when I'm struggling I can get an idea of what I need to do and it's easier to understand and learn. It would be nice to have this experience for our activities.
column16: Pay closer attention to how I'm learning and keeping track of some, if not all, learned functions (making a class-wide "cheat sheet" would be pretty cool too).

column14: Team work
column15: course load is heavy
column16: NA

column14: by far, the R primers
column15: videos or lectures where the instructor provides a basic/simpler description of the topics. Often times, when I ask for help, he describes it very simply that takes less than a minute to clear things up. Having these descriptions first before beginning the coursework would probably have much less confusing spots
column16: By far, it's to be proactive with the learning modules.

column14: The activities that allow us to implement R programming features are interesting and fun.
column15: Eliminate the learning journals. They don't seem to be a useful and necessary part of the course learning and grading. They are mostly tedious.
column16: Designate time every day to work on specifically this class material.

column14: easily accessible R documentation
column15: In person factor even though its not possible
column16: Practice R everyday
